Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: nicole w
Reviews.Content: I got married here last November. It was amazing! The staff was great, Monique was great and so helpful! I would recommend anyone to get married here or just stay for a night. My husband plan on staying here as often as we can just to enjoy it!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Wedding!”
Reviews.Author: Jayna024
Reviews.Content: This place is amazing. My husband and I held our ceremony and reception here (I loved not travelling to two seperate places!) and it was everything I could have asked for. We enjoyed an intimate, cozy yet elegant wedding. We had an outdoor ceremony followed by the reception with cocktails, dinner, and dancing. All my guests had such a wonderful time! I definitely shopped around and this was by far the best option for me. There were so many things that convinced me to book my wedding at this venue. The food was delicious, the drinks were constantly served, the servers were polite and made you feel like a guest in their home, the entire place itself was beautiful and Victorian like complimentary valet for all the guests, complimentary honeymoon suite with champagne and breakfast in bed in the morning, and soooo much more! But the best thing was Monique. She is the wedding coordinator for the Maple Manor Hotel and she was completely wonderful! Everything was very smooth and every detail was taken cared of. I am such worry wart and im always wanting to make sure everyone is having a good time, but Monique let me let loose and enjoy my own wedding. She had everything down "to a T" and that is something that you can't imagine having without. This place is amazing and the price is also extremely affordable since I didnt have a lot to work with. I could not imagine having a more perfect wedding than I did here. I recommend it highly to brides that want the intimate small wedding with no hassle or fuss. It was so easy to work with Monique and she made it the best day for me, my husband, and all of our guests!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place for our daughter's wedding!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: jillcowan
Reviews.Content: Our decision to have our daughter's wedding at Maple Manor was the best decision we made!! Everything was handled with great professionalism. Monique was exceptional! She and her staff were friendly, helpful, but most of all......got the job done! We were able to enjoy the evening totally and everything was carried out without a "hitch"!!! It was amazing! Thank you Maple Manor!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Wedding Venue!!!!”
Reviews.Author: classicbarbie0218
Reviews.Content: We had our wedding here last month and couldn't be happier with the whole experience from start to finish! Maple Manor itself is a vintage dream in uptown dallas! I must see!!! Very intimate and unique venue that cannot be matched for a smaller wedding in Dallas!! Monique is a wedding guru and made the whole process soooo stress free!! From planning to the day of she helps everything run so smoothly! We used most of the other vendors she personally suggested and they are just as awesome!! If you are looking for a wedding venue or a romatic weekend getaway you will not find anything more unique and charming than maple manor!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “The perfect location and venue for a wedding reception!!!!”
Reviews.Author: James54025
Reviews.Content: The Maple Manor Hotel hosted our daughter's wedding ceremony and reception. The event went perfectly. The outdoor courtyard was a great spot for the wedding service. And the dining room and dance floor worked quite nicely for reception. The food, service, and attention to detail were excellent. The hotel is located in the trendy Uptown section of Dallas which adds to its value. Working with an experienced staff made the wedding a memorable affair. We strongly recommend this location for any event.

Reviews.Title: “I would highly recommend the Maple Manor for any type of event.”
Reviews.Author: dennis_anntapper
Reviews.Content: We had my daughters wedding at the Maple Manor. As a "mother of the bride" from out of state, I really appreciated the fact that they pretty much handle it all. The wedding coordinator, Monique, was extremely helpful, and very accomodating whenever we had questions or needed to make changes to our menu or guest count. The entire event went very well-from the ceremony to dinner to dancing to the "Grand Exit", thanks entirely to Monique and her very organized staff. All the rooms and public areas are very elegant and beautifully decorated- the whole place has a wonderful victorian feel...right in the middle of uptown Dallas. All our guests say that they will remember the Maple Manor as a truly unique spot for a very memorable wedding! The food from the Old Warsaw Restaurant next door was excellent and plentiful, with lots of options to choose from. All in all, we feel very lucky to have found the Maple Manor for this most special event.

Reviews.Title: “The PERFECT wedding venue in Dallas”
Reviews.Author: AprilDavis
Reviews.Content: We just had our wedding at the Maple Manor on March 13, 2011. The day was perfect! The garden is an incredibly beautiful and romantic spot for the ceremony. The dining room was beautiful for dinner, and the food catered by the Old Warsaw was excellent! We got rave reviews from our friends and family. One of the best parts about this venue is Monique. She was absolutely awesome from start to finish. She is such a pro, and made sure everything was perfect and the way we wanted it for our special day! She was always very quick to respond to questions, and had everything perfectly organized for us. We are so incredibly glad that we chose this as our venue. All of our out of town relatives and in town friends loved it too! And the atrium makes for such awesome pictures for dancing and such! I can't stop talking about how awesome it was. The honeymoon suite was lovely for our wedding night as well. Two thumbs up for the jacuzzi tub! We loved it all and were so glad we picked this spot for our wedding.

Reviews.Title: “Maple Manor is a wonderful, romantic bed and breakfast in a great location in Dallas.”
Reviews.Author: SAMAGILL
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for our wedding night. The suite was beautiful - with two wonderful, romantic balconies. The bathroom had a huge jacuzzi and subdued lighting. The suite was decorated with gorgeous antiques and we were welcomed with a bottle of champagne. The breakfast that was brought to our room was delicious, and the staff brought us another pot of coffee and cream. I highly recommend Maple Manor Hotel to anyone looking for a romantic stay in Dallas. The photos truly do not show how nice the place is.

Reviews.Title: “Private Get Away w/in the City”
Reviews.Author: HOLMSTAGING
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Maple Manor right after New Years Eve. We were in the honeymoon suite and we were totally taken care of. Highly recommend The Old Warsaw for dinner. It's all about service and they provide a high quality level of that! We will be going back!

Reviews.Title: “A Perfect Wedding Location”
Reviews.Author: HeatherLK
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently got married at the Maple Manor Hotel. We spent weeks searching for the right venue and we could not be happier with our choice. The garden area of the Maple Manor is beautiful and was a lovely and intimate location for our ceremony. One of the best parts of booking your wedding here is, Monique. She will help you from start to finish and will never hesitate to go the extra mile to to answer your questions or to redo the seating arrangement even when you hit bumps in the road. Also, we had our reception at the Old Warsaw next door and the food was delicious. To sum up, the Maple Manor Hotel offers a beautiful, intimate location for weddings with great service. I would do it all over a again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Wedding Location”
Reviews.Author: Rob56463
Reviews.Content: We had our wedding here in May and canâ€™t stop talking about how amazing it was. First of all, Monique was great and made sure our wedding was perfect and we were happy from the day we selected the location (one year in advance) through the day after our wedding. She is clearly an expert in wedding planning and truly cares that we are happy throughout. She had great suggestions all through our event, but always let us make the decisions. Our food (provided by Old Warsaw next door) had everyone talking about how great it was. We had planned to have our wedding in the courtyard (out back) but it unexpectedly started raining just as the wedding was scheduled to start. Without any discussion (or extra charges) Monique helped us move the ceremony inside and we started 15 minutes later. Most people thought we had planned this all along. The hotel has a Victorian feel and look that lends itself to amazing pictures. It was great to have the ceremony and reception in the same placeâ€¦ itâ€™s so rare to find a beautiful location, great food, a gracious & competent planner all at once (and for a very reasonable price). I highly recommend Maple Manor Hotel for your wedding, you will be so glad you did.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect intimate wedding location”
Reviews.Author: katiembrown
Reviews.Content: Maple Manor was the first and only spot we looked at for our wedding! We wanted a small intimate wedding and Maple Manor was perfect in every way, from its unique Victorian charm to the romantic courtyard. Monique assisted us every step of the way and the day of wedding was perfect. We also received many compliments on the food that was prepared next door at the Old Warsaw. We had such a great experience here and would recommend to any of friends!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful space for a wedding!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I recently got married at Maple Manor and it was such a wonderful venue! Monique was very helpful and ran everything, I didn't stress about anything the day of which was important to me. We had so many compliments on the food and the beautiful space. I would recommend Maple Manor to anyone. It was a really wonderful experience.

Reviews.Title: “WONDERFUL WEDDING RECEPTION!”
Reviews.Author: xogirl1980
Reviews.Content: We are so happy to have chosen The Maple Manor as our reception location. Monique was VERY helpful and kept me informed of all the details and things needed for our big day. Our guests LOVED the food!! We heard lots and lots of compliments of the patio and beautiful flowers. I don't think we could have had a better place than this. The price was very reasonable for the location...... THANK YOU MONIQUE FOR EVERYTHING!! --Mr & Mrs Morales

Reviews.Title: “Wedding March 2010, loved it!!”
Reviews.Author: lora0784
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were married at the Maple Manor Hotel in March and we loved it! It was really nice to be able to have the wedding and reception in one location. The Old Warsaw is associated with the Maple Manor so the food was wonderful as well. They were also able to do the cake and had great recommendations for other vendors. Monique the coordinater was great and quick to respond to all my questions. It was very apparent that they had done this before and everything ran smoothly.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect wedding, perfect accomodations, perfect staff.”
Reviews.Author: Kougl
Reviews.Content: What an incredible experience. From the beginning, Monique, the coordinator, was exceptional. She helped make our wedding and reception perfect. Our accomodations were unbelievable. The staff was always willing to help. The food was delicious. I cannot express enough how blessed we felt the entire time we were there. Our family stayed there as well and felt like it was their vacation too. Thank you Monique and staff for making it a perfect start to the rest of our lives.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Wedding! Beatutiful Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Amanda184
Reviews.Content: When searching for the perfect location for my October 2009 wedding my daughter suggested Maple Manor. We went to look at this venue and several other venues and immediately fell in love with this location. I loved the victorian charm and I really felt confident that Monique, the wedding coordinator, could help us create the perfect, stress free wedding. A few months later that is exactly what we got! We had a very small intimate wedding and did not have to worry about any details. The food from the Old Warsaw was excellent, the service was first class and the atmosphere was perfect for our style.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Wedding Value”
Reviews.Author: CercaSevillano
Reviews.Content: My wife and I discovered Maple Manor when we were tipped off by a friend. We met with Monique, she was courteous and answered all of our questions. Many of the vendors she recommends are well known within the Dallas area, though most were a bit pricey for us. (We found a fantastic photographer and DJ for much less.) On the day of, things went fairly smoothly. Being that it is such a small hotel there isn't much of a staff, so you really do have the run of the place. Be prepared to bring in your own sound system if having the ceremony in the courtyard (which is gorgeous), the house sound system is in bad shape. The rooms are very nice (we dug the huge in-room jacuzzi in the bridal suite). Great photo ops due to the location. The food was everything we hoped for (though we weren't able to have a tasting). I strongly recommend the farewell brunch, it was excellent. And I have to remember to get the name of the complementary champagne we were given as it was incredible. Overall the hotel is very charming, well appointed, allows for near-total privacy, and provided everything we asked for.

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful wedding and a party I'll never forget!”
Reviews.Author: Electriclizzyland
Reviews.Content: I had my wedding at Maple Manor in October this past year, and it was a wonderful experience. Everything was beautiful and very well organized. The food was excellent, and the bar service was seamless. We offered an open bar, and I never noticed anyone getting or needing a drink, and to me that is a very good thing. The event coordinator, Monique, saved the day when our wedding cake was never delivered. She made a few calls and had a backup cake there in plenty of time. Thanks to her and my wedding party, I never even knew about the issue until my ceremony was over, and the reception was about to begin! The rooms were elegant and comfortable, especially the bridal suite. My wedding party stayed in three of the rooms, so we got to see more of the hotel that way, and it was all equally posh. We had the entire hotel to ourselves, and were able to relax on the large rooftop balcony after the night was over. My wedding party took a some very special photos as a group with a stunning Uptown view. The next morning, our in-room breakfast was delicious and arrived exactly to the minute requested, with excellent coffee and special vegetarian items for me. It's not "cheap", but it is a value for what you get, considering the quality and especially the personal service. My wedding was money well spent.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the risk for your wedding.”
Reviews.Author: Amie-FTW
Reviews.Content: This place is charming and some people have had wonderful experiences. However, it is a risk. We booked the hotel for our wedding, paid our deposits and started sending our invitations to our wedding. At 94 days prior to our wedding, the coordinator, Monique, no-showed to an appointment and was unapologetic and rude about it. At that point we learned that she had also lied to us prior to signing the contract. At 94 days prior to the wedding, we had to scramble for a new venue. Once the contract was signed, it was not a pleasant experience working with Monique. Her father is the owner of the hotel, so don't expect any help there either. Notice that other reviewers either had an excellent experience or a horrible one. And ask yourself, do your really want to take that kind of gamble on the most important day of your life? If you would like more information on our experience, email me at aa.wedding2009ATgmail.com

Reviews.Title: “Maple Manor Hotel- The perfect romantic and intimate weddding venue in Dallas, TX”
Reviews.Author: esutton13
Reviews.Content: Our wedding at the Maple Manor Hotel was perfect. The Maple Manor is a romantic and intimate wedding venue set in downtown Dallas. It is a historic bed and breakfast with five individually decorated Victorian styled rooms. I have always wanted to get married in a unique place; the Maple Manor was just that and more. As soon as I visited the Maple Manor, I knew that this was the place I wanted to be married at. The staircase leading down to the courtyard for the ceremony is directly out of a fairy tale. It provides the perfect entrance for the bride and her wedding party. The honeymoon suite is a great place for the bridal party to get ready in. Also, we enjoyed the honeymoon suite for our honeymoon night with a king size bed, huge Jacuzzi tub, and a wonderful breakfast in bed the following morning. Monique (wedding coordinator) and her staff went above and beyond in providing their services for our wedding. Monique provided reassurance and answers to all of our wedding questions. She was always available for consultation and knew exactly what she was doing. The wedding dinner, catered by the Old Warsaw Restaurant, was amazing and delicious. We had approximately 130 guests and the Maple Manor could have easily accommodated more. I have had numerous wedding guests tell me how great the food was and that our wedding was the best wedding they had been to in a very long time. It is just such an elegant and unusual location in the midst of downtown Dallas. I would highly recommend the Maple Manor to all brides and grooms as a wedding venue in the Dallas Metroplex. The Maple Manor is everything and more that you could possibly want for your wedding ceremony and reception.

Reviews.Title: “Wedding May 22, 2009”
Reviews.Author: jada972
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had our wedding on May 22nd and it was beautiful. The food was wonderful and the service was great. Monique the coordinator was organized and dealt with the confusion of my family and guest. We received great reviews regarding the location, the food and the service. The only thing we need to add to the direction were flowers. The price was affordable.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Wedding Location! Everything in one place!”
Reviews.Author: jrgarza1
Reviews.Content: We just got Married at the Maple Manor and we couldn't have found a more perfect place. They handled everything from coordination of the ceremony and dinner to the reception. Everything went smooth as silk. Food was amazing and the bridal suite was perfect. It was great that we didnt have to worry about the details because Monique took care of everything. Thanks for making our special day memorable!

Reviews.Title: “No better Wedding Location in the metroplex for your $$$$$”
Reviews.Author: Daffinee82
Reviews.Content: For your money, you cannot get a better all-inclusive package than the Maple Manor in the Dallas Arts District. The location was both meaningful and intimate to my fiance and myself. Our guests loved the old victorian style of the indoor dining area and suites and the compliment received most often was how wonderful the food was (it is included in the package from the Old Warsaw Restaurant adjacent to the hotel)!!! You not only get food, beverage, table, linen, ceremony seating, and a bridal suite to get ready in and stay in the night-of, but you get complimentary wedding coordinator services so you, your photographer, dj, or video crew do not have to cue any of the traditional wedding moments. They also have a bad-weather alternative ceremony plan that we had to use which was great. Our familes and guests were extremely pleased!!!!

Reviews.Title: “An Elegant Wedding Filled With Romance!”
Reviews.Author: cmunk85
Reviews.Content: I wanted my wedding day to be filled with pure romance and elegance, and that is exactly what Monique and the Maple Manor Hotel delivered. The wedding day was perfect and people always tell you something will go wrong, but NOTHING did and it was fabulous! Monique treated me and my bridesmaids wonderfully as we got ready to go to the church bringing us champagne and cheers as we rode off in the limo. The food was fabulous and everything was done seamlessly as far as the agenda for the evening. My mother and other family members loved working with Monique on the set up and through out the evening. The hotel is ominous at night and purely romantic. I couldn't have asked for anything better!

Reviews.Title: “Everything We Hoped It Would Be”
Reviews.Author: TravelingTexan77
Reviews.Content: We got married here in May. For about a month after, everytime I saw one of our guests, they commented on how great the food was. My goal for our wedding was to keep it as stress free as possible. Working with Monique was just that, stress free! Things could not have gone smoother.

Reviews.Title: “Dream of a Fairytale Wedding”
Reviews.Author: kissykeikocakes
Reviews.Content: We had been searching for an intimate and unique place for our wedding, and fell in love with Maple Manor the moment we saw it! The Victorian Manor, with it's beautiful antique look, and the lovely garden with gas lamps and fountain. Monique (wedding coordinator) was extremely helpful, quick to answer calls & emails as well as having plenty of suggestions and making sure everything went just how we wanted it to. Our wedding was in the garden at night, twinkling and beautiful, and was matched by the wonderful reception and great food inside. Many people told us it was the best wedding they had ever been to! We chose to do a brunch the next morning as well, it was nice to see everyone before we left, and to just come downstairs and enjoy a wonderful breakfast before we left for our honeymoon! I would recommend Maple Manor to anyone (in fact we have already to one friend) so they might be guaranteed a great experience , and at a wonderful price.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for a wedding!”
Reviews.Author: Joasis
Reviews.Content: We had our wedding there and everything was great! Monique the coordinator is very accomodating and guides you along the entire way. She helped answer many of my questions about planning a wedding and was always prompt in returning phone calls or emails. The garden area was the perfect setting for our wedding as we enjoy nature, and the location of the hotel was perfect for our out of town guests. There are plenty of things to do in the area. Then there was the food, the steaks were absolutely yummy! Not sure how they get all the food out hot but they did and everone was extremely satisfied. The rooms were really spectacular and spacious and the gas lamps make it even more romantic. It truly was the best day of our lives and Maple Manor definitely had a hand in that! Thanks Monique for all your hard work!

Reviews.Title: “Magical wedding at Maple Manor”
Reviews.Author: cchani
Reviews.Content: The moment we walked into the Maple Manor we knew that this was where we wanted to have our wedding! The location was a huge plus, being in the middle of Uptown and close to restaurants and clubs. The Bridal Suite was amazing! The room was comfortable with an amazing view. And the Bathroom! It has this huge jacazui tub that I couldnâ€™t wait to get in! My bridal party even all got in there and took some pictures to surprise me with! I didnâ€™t have a planner for the wedding and when the day arrived I was more overwhelmed than I imagined. Monique was a lifesaver. She got our flowers ready for pictures and did so many things I didnâ€™t even realize needed to be done. Iâ€™m pretty sure I would have had a breakdown without her help! The food was great, and breakfast in bed the next morning was heavenly! I would, and have suggested Maple Manor to anyone getting married and also for out of towners looking for a place to stay. We hope to book it for our anniversary too!

Reviews.Title: “Wedding Weekend”
Reviews.Author: KMD6708
Reviews.Content: We had our wedding at the Maple Manor Hotel and everything was fabulous! We had many guest coming in from out of town, so having the wedding, reception, and a place for us and our bridal party to stay all at the same location was super convenient for everyone! The price was more than fair (and included many extra ammenties needed for a wedding---linens, tables/chairs, valet parking for guests, cake stand, etc.) Monique was very helpful in all stages of the planning and set up for the rehearsal, and ceremony/reception set-up--directing the vendors, etc. We had about 65 guests attend our wedding, so the size of the garden (for the ceremony) and the dinning room was perfect, and could of easily held many more people! The food was amazing (many guests said it was the best wedding food they had ever had!) and the bar staff definitely kept the tables clear of empty glasses as the reception continued through the evening. My husband and I stayed in the bridal suite that evening, and our bridal party stayed in the remaing rooms. The hotel is small, so we reserved all the rooms in order to make things more private (where as in a large hotel, random guests could easily peak in on your special day). In the morning we all had a great breakfast and had a moment to relax before we all departed. The Maple Manor is a lovely Victoria-era home that still has much of it's original decor...it was the service combined with the classic, unique look of the building that made our wedding perfect. When the Bride and Groom have a great time--then you know the wedding was a success!

Reviews.Title: “Our Perfect Wedding”
Reviews.Author: designsred
Reviews.Content: We had our perfect wedding at the Maple Manor Hotel. The garden was magical, the dining room was beautiful, and the food was great! Monique, the hotel manager, also made our wedding stress free. I will definitaly have my anniversary there to relive our perfect day. :)

Reviews.Title: “A Flawless Wedding & Reception”
Reviews.Author: solofromdallas
Reviews.Content: There are so many positives things to say about Maple Manor, specifically Monique, who not only kept me on task, but understood my time crunch and that I was planning this without my finacee, who lived out of town, finishing Grad School. She was always prompt in responding to any question I had, patient with last minute changes and provided some GREAT recommendations (I used her recommendation for the custom grooms cake I wanted, the florist, a DJ AND a photographer) all of which were outstanding, and Monique made sure it all went off without a hitch. I received so many compliments, from friends and family, all saying what a beautiful wedding (the outdoor courtyard was intimate & elagant) it was and how much fun the reception was. The buffet went over almost like a sit down dinner, with cocktails and music.... all in one place, making it so much more enjoyable for all involved! Our immediate family stayed in the hotel Friday and Saturday night, and there was an incredible breakfast (for about 10 of us) served in the dinning room on Sunday morning. A PERFECT send off to top off a perfect wedding and reception. I could go on and on, but will end it with this, CALL Monique, one meeting with her and your wedding/reception will be in the best of hands!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Wedding Destination”
Reviews.Author: mollyannd
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had our wedding at the Maple Manor and we fell in love with the location. We had great service and we were amazed at how courteous the staff was and how willing they were to go out of their way to make our wedding special. I highly recommend the Maple Manor!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Setting for my Wedding”
Reviews.Author: mkemery
Reviews.Content: I got married at Maple Manor in August of 2008 and I could not have chosen a more perfect venue. They provide an amazing wedding coordinator who was wonderful! She made sure I didn't leave out any details and always made the space available when my mother or I needed to visit the location in the months prior to the event. The hotel has a gorgeous garden/courtyard for saying your vows, an elegant dining room, and fun reception hall. The whole event flowed smoothly; even my guests told me later that the staff was friendly and helpful to them. The catered food was the best we've ever tasted. The rooms in the hotel are decorated in an amazing victorian style - just look at their website! The provided honeymooon suite was an unforgettable romatic retreat and the in-room breakfast was delicious! I'll never forget my amazing wedding and night at Maple Manor Hotel. My guests enjoyed it too. The hotel has so much character that it made my wedding extremely unique... something every bride wants! I recommend this hotel for any bride (in fact, one of my friends already booked it for her wedding too!). Maple Manor *knows* weddings and it shows. Two thumbs up, five stars, etc! Thank you Maple Manor!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent experience for our wedding!!”
Reviews.Author: BaylorSMU
Reviews.Content: We had our wedding in October at the Maple Manor garden with reception following and were truly pleased with the whole experience from start to finish. The wedding coordinator was very flexible and worked with our ideas and our schedules offering to meet us at night and on weekends to work out details. The rooms were large with a nice patio we enjoyed. Breakfast the next morning was great as well. Our friends and family from out of town continue to rave about the garden, the food, and the overall day. I would highly recommend Maple Manor for any bride planning a wedding in Dallas.

Reviews.Title: “a Romantic Garden Getaway in Downtown Dallas Texas”
Reviews.Author: hotelconossuire
Reviews.Content: The Maple Manor is a hidden gem in Big City Dallas with a beautiful garden, stately antique rooms, an elegant dining/bar area and a great reception/dance area.Wedding planner,Monique,saw to every detail so that we could relax and enjoy our Big Day.The 4 course meal(for 100 people!) came out hot and delicious for all guests,as expected from the famous restaurant, The Old Warsaw.The piano playing in the background at dinner was my mother's favorite and walking me down the Grand Stairs into the ceremony was my father's.My husband loved the garden string quartet and the jazzy fun band. I loved that Monique took care of everything and had great vendors to choose from so my tasks were minimal.Our hot tub/jacuzzi, covered in rose petals and complimentary champagne finished off a great night.My husband and I plan to return for our anniversary time and time again.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommend for Brides to Be!!!”
Reviews.Author: HOLMSTAGING
Reviews.Content: In searching for the perfect wedding venue a gem of a location presented itself called Maple Manor Hotel. We looked at all the high end options but in the end made our selection of Maple Manor due to the uniqueness of the venue and professionalism of Monique Heidari-Ramos. It's been 8 months since our wedding and I have to say I wouldn't have changed a thing about our special day. We used the entire space of the house and courtyards to celebrate and dance the night away (which of course FLEW by). At the end of the evening the honeymoon suite was just what we needed - just a few steps away w/ luxury accomodations. It is a unique experience at Maple Manor, due to the size the setting is intimate and allowed us to spend time with all of our 150 guests (which is rare from what I've heard). A wedding can be an expensive event in life, but no one wants it to be less than amazing...enter Maple Manor, you will not be disappointed and your guests (like ours) will say, I never knew this amazing place was even here! While it IS a secret garden of sorts, I bet that changes really soon. Just visit their website and you will see what I am talking about! Wishing all brides to be the very best! Our wedding at Maple Manor far exceeded expectations, special thanks to Monique Heidari-Ramos, Event Coordinator.

Reviews.Title: “Had our wedding there and loved it!”
Reviews.Author: GlobetrotterDallas
Reviews.Content: I read some of the reviews of this venue and all I can say is that we had a fantastic experience. We booked all the rooms, stayed three days in the Manor, and had our wedding there with 80 guests. Monique and her staff helped in every way they could. Monique was instrumental in guiding us through the wedding planning and preparation, even if our problem was not related to her venue. We loved the old historic Victorian feel of the Manor. The jaccuzi tubs were unreal! Breakfast had all the bells and whistles. We kicked tires at a lot of places, and value for money, Maple Manor was tops. When my new bride and I were being driven off in the limo, she started to cry and said "this was our fairy tale wedding."

Reviews.Title: “Horrible!! Would never recommend.”
Reviews.Author: Bella_n_Edward
Reviews.Content: The following is an email I sent to the hotel. This was our 1st anniversary. Before I send any reviews or further opinions I wanted to give the opportunity for a response and compensation on our stay November 29, 2008. We were in suite 6. Upon arrival we had to find someone to ask about how to check in. We were told the room was unlocked which was different not having to check in but was fine. I kinda thought it was pretty cool except those things should be told before we arrive so as to not wander around looking for which room was ours. At first look I thought the room was pretty nice. We brought our bags in and I started looking around. The bath had several long black hairs in it. GROSS. I admit I have a very big thing about other peoples hair, but anybody would have been shocked. We decided to turn on the fireplace. After a bit of tinkering with it my husband was able to get it on. Instructions would have been nice. We go to turn on the TV. Remote doesn't work properly. We then try the TV in the bathroom...only the DVD function would work. We were told there would be a bottle of champagne upon arrival, (in the fridge I was told), but it was nowhere to be found. I go to the phone on the bedside and try to call down. The phone was nothing but static and it wouldn't let me dial out. I use the phone in the bathroom. I tell them about the TV and champagne. The champagne showed up but after getting back from dinner at your restaurant next door, which was also far below what I expected, still no TV. My husband goes to pour the champagne and I guess it may not be that big of deal but even our champagne glasses didn't match each other. Next morning, we get our breakfast. The toast was so cold and the butter so hard it wouldn't even spread. After it was delivered we had another knock and they handed us the bacon that was forgotten. Well they could of just saved the trip it was so burnt and gross. This was our 1st anniversary and I am so disappointed in every aspect. Dinner, which I don't think you have any control over, was barely average. For the cost of it I had much higher expectations. My husband found a small black hair in the cherry jubilee but at that point we were just ready to leave. The overall feeling of our night, especially with the money we spent, was that nobody really cared how our stay was. We have stayed at $100 rooms that had better service and were much cleaner. I was really looking forward to our stay hoping for something different that we could try and make a tradition for our marriage. I can't stress enough how upset and disappointed I am. I will be waiting for your response. I waited a day and sent the email again asking for a response. I was told the email was sent to the manager and he would contact me. I waited another day and I called. Friday I was called by the manager and he was quite rude and I was basiclly told that we just didn't know how to work a TV and everyone else was happy. They offered a gift certificate for another night. Why would I want to stay there again even if it's free? The website looks like it's a nice place but beware, it is not well maintained and nobody there really seems to care.

Reviews.Title: “Beware!”
Reviews.Author: DallasHoney
Reviews.Content: I recently completed a stay at the Maple Manor Hotel. When I arrived at the hotel there was no one at the desk to check in. My friend and I secured a key from the valet at the Old Warsaw restaurant. There was no one at the desk all night, so no security was provided during the stay. The next morning, the only way we were able to check out was to leave the key with the housekeeper. Although my friend and I found the hotel to be quaint and the breakfast to be satisfactory, we were disappointed that the frame of our antique bed was broken and the toilet paper holder was falling off of the bathroom wall. Because of the affiliation of the hotel to the Old Warsaw restaurant, I expected much higher standards and much better service at the hotel. The lack of consideration to the protection and comfort of hotel guests has promted me to write this review.

Reviews.Title: “The ultimate in UNprofessionalism”
Reviews.Author: Cocotravelaire
Reviews.Content: I attended a wedding here and spent the night afterward. There is a complete lack of respect and attention to detail from the staff. The place was dirty, the food was sub-par, the toilets didn't flush. The staff simply did not seem to care. I would not recommend this place to anyone, especially for a wedding. If you intend to stay the night here, think twice. You might want to find a hotel that is clean and has appropriate staffing.

Reviews.Title: “did not receive what was paid for!”
Reviews.Author: jerseycouple2007
Reviews.Content: Paid over $9000.00 for wedding to be held there and we rented the entire 6 rooms in the hotel for a few of our guests. Coordinator there was unprofessional and guests complained she was rude. Dinner was over an hour late. My cc was charged without my consent/authorization. The hotel rooms are very beautiful! But, there was NO soap in any of the rooms dirty/wet towels from previous guests, room not ready for check in until 430pm! SEVERAL reqeuests made and agreed upon in contract were not upheld! Could not locate decor we used for our wedding and then staff cleared them without letting us know where to pick them up from!! Over all professionalism was lacking and disappointed that we had to worry about so much on our wedding day.
